contest-event.event-date:
May 6, 1944 D Edinburgh Charities Contest
Edinburgh Charities Contest 0 Other
edinburgh-charities-contest
March, Hymn and Own Choice Test Piece Contest
Princes Street Gardens, Edinburgh
March contest 1st Bathgate, 2nd Clydebank, 3rd Wellesley. Hymn tune 1st Bathgate, 2nd Clydebank, 3rd Parkhead (did not play in selection). Deportment 1st Tullis Russell, 2nd Wellesley, 3rd Barry Ostlere and Shepherd. Best section 2 band - Buckhaven. Best section 3 band - Shotts (were then disqualified and prize awarded to City of Edinburgh). Best section 4 band - Bathgate.
13 bands competed.
Feb. 7, 2011, 1:26 a.m. March 5, 2013, 3:30 p.m.
1 Clydebank Burgh Band George Hawkins A Downland Suite
2 Barry, Ostlere & Shepherd John Faulds Tannhäuser [unknown arranger]
3 Wellesley Colliery Band Thomas Proctor Coriolanus
4 Blackbraes John Faulds Tannhäuser [unknown arranger]
5 Bathgate Band J. Riley Beethoven's Works [arr. W. Rimmer]
6 Shotts St Patrick's Brass John Faulds Labour and Love
7 Buckhaven and District Miners' Charles Terris Wagner [arr. Round]
Unknown Result Leith Silver W. Tabener La Traviata [unknown arranger]
Unknown Result Bowhill Colliery and District Silver Band Charles Terris Oberon [unknown arranger]
Unknown Result Douglas Colliery Gregor Grant Grand Selection: Mendelssohn's Works [arr. Rimmer]
Unknown Result Dysart Colliery Silver Band William Laycock William Tell Overture [arr. Grant]
Unknown Result Tullis Russell Mills John Haldane Rienzi [unknown arranger]
Unknown Result City of Edinburgh Band F. Morris Mirella - overture [unknown arranger]
